intro: Lagoseriopsis, commonly known as the goldenweed, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, yellowish to golden flowers that bloom in compact clusters. The plant typically has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in dry, sandy soils. Lagoseriopsis species are native to regions of southern Africa and are adapted to arid environments. They play a role in supporting local pollinators and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
